page.title: 17Broughton Castle:Banbury (1)
page.content: Broughton Castle was built in {1300} as a manor house and took about 10 years to build. In the {Civil War} of 1642 to 1649 it was used for the {headquarters of the Parliamentarians} against king Charles I. {Lord Saye} was one of the leaders of the Parliamentarians who gathered at Broughton Castle before the Civil War began to plot against the king. When the War started they had a regiment there. Lord Saye had his own {regiment of Bluecoats} and the regiment slept at Broughton Castle. The big roof space is still known as the {Barracks}. So it was a garrison in the Civil War. After the Battle of Edgehill, the first battle in the Civil war, the Castle was {beseiged by the Royalists} and they surrendered. So it was captured.
